alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, central Orleans, north central Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 1000 PM CDT... At 932 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near East New Orleans, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, East New Orleans, Harvey, Belle Chasse, Gretna, Terrytown, Violet, Meraux, Arabi and Poydras. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 239 and 251. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
